title: Enhancing waste resource efficiency: circular economy for sustainability and energy conversion - Frontiers
summary: This article focuses on the evolution of the circular economy (CE) concept, highlighting the transition from a linear to a circular approach in various economic sectors. The concept of waste as a valuable resource for energy transformation is emphasized, exemplified by the case study of the Orli Staw waste treatment facility in Poland, showcasing the practical implementation of CE principles.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the concept of a circular economy, which involves extending product life cycles and minimizing waste, meeting the criteria for green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE. The case study of the Orli Staw waste treatment facility demonstrates a novel approach to waste management, utilizing kitchen and garden biowaste to produce biogas, aligning with the definition of business innovation.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific product that meets the criteria for a green product.
green_process: TRUE. The biogas production process described in the Orli Staw case study involves the conversion of biowaste into energy, meeting the criteria for a green process.

title: Recent NSF Awards in Design for Environmental Sustainability in Computing Are Advancing US National Priorities - National Science Foundation
summary: The National Science Foundation (NSF) has awarded $13 million to 25 research teams seeking to contribute to technological innovation and environmental sustainability in computer systems. Recent award highlights include the George Washington University and The Ohio University's development of reusable computer parts to extend their lifespan and reduce carbon costs, and the University of Pittsburgh and University of Notre Dame's work on connecting retired computer chips to create devices that rival newly manufactured ones, thereby reducing pollution and electronic waste. These projects aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, optimize water consumption in data centers, and develop eco-friendly computing materials and algorithms for better use of renewable energy sources.

title: Intelligent OTN Solution: Enabling Fast and Simplified Deployment of Self-Healing Networks - ZTE
summary: ZTE has introduced a collaborative solution integrating network management and control with WDM/OTN automatically switched optical network (WASON). Additionally, new intelligent technologies such as power balancing and flexible grids have also been unveiled. These efforts are aimed at building highly intelligent transmission networks for customers.

title: From gadget to garbage - newagebd.net
summary: Bangladesh generates 2.7 million tons of e-waste annually, a number expected to double by 2030. E-waste poses a severe threat to the environment and human health due to toxic and hazardous materials and improper disposal practices. The country lacks a comprehensive approach to e-waste management, including inadequate infrastructure, lack of effective multi-stakeholder engagement, and insufficient investment.
green_innovation: TRUE, by developing a framework for e-waste management, Bangladesh can reduce environmental externalities through better data collection, improved infrastructure and technology for e-waste collection and recycling, implementation of Extended Producer Responsibility, and encouraging innovation and research on new products, processes, and business models.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new or improved process for e-waste management that differs significantly from previous processes, and it has been brought into use in the country.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific product.
green_process: TRUE, the article describes a new or improved process for e-waste management that differs significantly from previous processes, and it has been brought into use in the country.
greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not describe a product or process innovation that is an example of greenwashing.

title: Cenviro's Contribution To Circular Economy in Advancing Malaysia - The Edge Malaysia
summary: Cenviro, a waste management company in Malaysia, is shifting its focus towards the circular economy model by accelerating its recycling and recovery efforts. Cenviro owns and operates Malaysia's first and Southeast Asia's largest integrated waste management centre, and has recently invested RM200 million to enhance its recycling and recovery capabilities. The company plans to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions intensity by 5% by 2025, and is considering an initial public offering (IPO) to fund future growth.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes Cenviro's shift towards the circular economy model, which is a green innovation that reduces negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes Cenviro's investment in new recycling and recovery facilities, which are business innovations that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the company's waste management processes.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe any specific green products.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes Cenviro's use of solar panels, treated wastewater, and rainwater harvesting, which are all green processes that reduce the company's environmental impact.

title: Embracing the Digital Revolution: A Paradigm Shift in FMCG Supply Chain Management - Indian Retailer
